alert.note: Alert for Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 7:59PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Lucie and northeastern Martin Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 759 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Port Saint Lucie River Park, or near Port Saint Lucie, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Fort Pierce, Stuart and White City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Florida.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland St. Lucie
